resources.string: *values should be a whole and real number
*values should be a whole and real number

Inverse Kinematics allows us to specify the desired position(x,y,z) and orientation(θ, ψ, φ) of the end effector with respect to its base. Those values will then be send to the pyBullet simulation where you can see your Kuka robot at its new destination!

This screen allows us to control the orientation of the end-effector by simply rotating our phone! Toggle the button to start, rotate your phone and see how your robot\'s orientation is changed in pyBullet!

BulletBot is an app designed for controlling robots remotely and powered by the pyBullet simulation engine. Through a simple and intuitive user interface the app enables inverse kinematics, 360deg sensor motion control and more performed in real time on a pyBullet simulation of the Kuka robot.
